review: They don't really tell you that you'll have to be a prime member to watch stuff and even if you are, you have to buy the majority of everything you'd want to watch.
author: Ariel Clark

review: Easy to install and set up. I am waiting for the USB Power cable to arrive because my power outlet is far from the TV so I am using an extension cord. (not very high tech )Only reason I didn't give it five stars is I feel the video set up guide could be a little more specific. It does not explain clearly what streaming and other services are included , how to access what you subscibe to already and what is an additional purchase.
author: Kimberly Sanders

review: Amazing!! The fact that can access Prime videos, Hulu, and Netflix all from my "non-smart" tv without having to plug my laptop into it is just awesome!  Definitely recommend 40 mbps internet at a minimum though. Have Time Warner 70 mbps and there is rarely even a hint of buffering except with YouTube...but always seems to suck no matter what device or whose internet i use.  Kudos to Amazon for not trying to be overly territorial and restrictive with the Firestick like they were with the first Kindle Fire!
author: Amazon Addict

review: its fine but i should give 5 Stars if do not get frozen too often..this drive me nut..
author: tony mercado ventura

review: I like it so far...Still trying to learn all the in's and out's...
author: Sean OFlannery

review: Works great as long as you have a decent Wi-Fi signal.  We use it with our fifth wheel camper when there is no cable service available or too may trees to set up our satellite dish.
author: Jerry Botdorf

review: it needs it's own power outlet. I thought it was self powered. other than that, it works fine.
author: MIKE B.

review: Meets expectación And is simple to use
